contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Zygmunt_Gloger.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Zygmunt Gloger]] '''Zygmunt Gloger''' (3 November 1845, [[Kamianets-Podilskyi]], Ukraine - 16 August 1910, [[Warsaw]]) was a Polish historian, archeologist, geographer and ethnographer, bearer of [[Prus II Wilczekosy coat of arms|Wilczekosy coat of arms]]. ==Life== Under the influence of Julian Bartoszewicz, [[Józef Ignacy Krasicki]], and later [[Wincenty Pol]] and [[Oskar Kolberg]] he voyaged through Poland and Lithuania, and corresponded with many European scholars. Founder of [[Towarzystwo Krajoznawcze]] (precursor of modern [[PTTK]]), in his will he gave his impressive collection to that organization, as well as to Towarzystwo Ethnograficzne, Towarzystwo Bibliotek Publicznych w Warszawie and Museum of Industry and Agriculture. His life's work was the ''Encyklopedia staropolska ilustrowana'' (1900-1903), still considered a useful and important book about culture of [[Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth]]. His other works include ''Obchody weselne'' (1869), ''Pieśni ludu'' (1892), ''Księga rzeczy polskich'' (1896), ''Rok polski w życiu, tradycji i pieśni'' (1900). ==Works== * {{pl icon}} {{cite book | author=Zygmunt Gloger | coauthors = | title =Geografia historyczna ziem dawnej Polski | year =1900 | editor = | pages = | publisher =Spółka Wydawnicza Polska | location =Kraków | url=http://monika.univ.gda.pl/~literat/glogre/ | isbn =83-214-0883-4 }} * [http://pl.wikisource.org/wiki/Encyklopedia_staropolska "Encyklopedia staropolska"], Zygmunt Gloger, 1900-1903, online * [http://monika.univ.gda.pl/~literat/gloger/ "Dolinami rzek.
